article: A B C D The job of raising children is a tough one. Children don't come with an instruction manual.And each child is _ . So parents sometimes pull their hair out in frustration, not _ what to do. But in raising children, what we do is _ by our culture. Naturally then, American parents teach their children basic American _ . To Americans, the goal of parents is to help children _ on their own feet. From _ , each child may get his or her own room. As children grow, they get more _ to make their own choices. _ choose their own forms of entertainment, as well as the friends to _ them with. When they _ young adulthood, they choose their own jobs and marriage _ .Of course, many young adults still _ their parents' advice and approval for the choices they make. But once they "leave the _ " at around 18 to 21 years old, they want to be on their own, not _ to their mothers' apron strings. The relationship between parents and children in America is very informal. American parents _ their children as individuals not as extensions of themselves. They _ them to achieve their own dreams. Americans praise, encourage and give their children the _ to succeed. When children become adults, their parents becomes more like _ . But _ to popular belief, most adult Americans don't make their parents pay for room and board when their parents come to _ them. Even as adults, they respect and honor their parents.
